LockUp Version Setup Defending your privacy LockUp Icon Preferences Device Compromised! LockUp Enabled
Language Select the language to use for the interface The user interface will use %1$s for the language Periodically update the signature database Keep up to date Defense Mechanisms Trigger Mechanisms Application Configuration Enable or Disable Push Notifications Push Notifications Help improve the LockUp application Help Improve LockUp Trigger a response when a known forensic tool or exploit is detected Block forensic techniques LockUp /* SHA256 LockUp */ Plausible deniability password Plausible deniability password Click to change the plausible deniability password Trigger a response when a plausible deniability password is entered Plausible deniability Start on boot Start defending as soon as the device loads the Android OS LockUp will start defending this device when the Android OS is loaded LockUp will run for %1$s after enabling LockUp will run for Forever after enabling Enabled for Defend using LockUp will defend using a %1$s How should LockUp respond to events? The default is to factory reset the device Required power A event will be triggered on next boot if downtime exceeds %1$s Trigger a response when the device downtime exceeds a given period of time Required unlock A event will be immediately triggered if no login occurs every %1$s Trigger a response when the device has not been unlocked within a given period of time LockUp Enabled LockUp Disabled LockUp Uses this policy to lock and wipe the device when events are triggered. LockUp Application Warning! A malicious event has been detected. ERROR! Caught an exception while trying to protect the device. Failing open :( ERROR! LockUp does not have the right privileges. Failing open :( Thank you for choosing LockUp. Please come back again!
